main module

Main file of the tool, used to run all the steps.

main.main()[source]

Get the arguments and run the appropriate functions.

main.run_steps(dl, region, regionless, steps, start, end, source, output, catalog, database, table, queryfile, exists, timeframe)[source]

Run the steps of the tool (enum, config, logs extraction, logs analysis).

Parameters:

  • dl (bool) – True if the user wants to download the results, False if he wants the results to be written in a s3 bucket

  • region (str) – Region in which the tool is executed

  • regionless (str) – “not-all” if the tool is used on only one region. First region to run the tool on otherwise

  • steps (list of str) – Steps to run (1 for enum, 2 for config, 3 for logs extraction, 4 for analysis)

  • start (str) – Start time for logs collection

  • end (str) – End time for logs collection

  • source (str) – Source bucket for the analysis part (4)

  • output (str) – Output bucket for the analysis part (4)

  • catalog (str) – Data catalog used with the database

  • database (str) – Database containing the table for logs analytics

  • table (str) – Contains the sql requirements to query the logs

  • queryfile (str) – File containing the queries

  • exists (tuple of bool) – If the input db and table already exists

  • timeframe (str) – Time filter for default queries

main.set_args()[source]

Define the arguments used when calling the tool.

main.verify_all_regions(input_region)[source]

Search for all enabled regions and verify that the given region exists (region that the tool will begin with).

Parameters:

input_region (str) – If we’re in this function, the used decided to run the tool on all enabled functions. This given region is the first one that the tool will analyze.

main.verify_bucket(bucket, type)[source]

Verify that the user inputs regarding the buckets logs are correct.

Parameters:

  • bucket (str) – Bucket we verify it exists

  • type (str) – Source or output bucket (for log analysis)

Returns:

bucket – Bucket we verify it exists

Return type:

str

main.verify_dates(start, end, steps)[source]

Verify if the date inputs are correct.

Parameters:

  • start (str) – Start time

  • end (str) – End time

  • steps (list of str) – Steps to run

main.verify_file(queryfile, steps)[source]

Verify if the query file input is correct.

Parameters:

  • queryfile (str) – Yaml file containing the query

  • steps (list of str) – Steps to run

main.verify_one_region(region)[source]

Verify the region inputs and run the steps of the tool for one region.

Parameters:

region (str) – Region to run the tool in

Returns:

good – True if the region is enabled

Return type:

bool

main.verify_steps(steps, source, output, catalog, database, table, region, dl)[source]

Verify that the steps entered are correct.

Parameters:

  • steps (list of str) – Steps to run (1 for enum, 2 for config, 3 for logs extraction, 4 for analysis)

  • source (str) – Source bucket for the analysis part (4)

  • output (str) – Output bucket for the analysis part (4)

  • catalog (str) – Data catalog used with the database

  • database (str) – Database containing the table for logs analytics

  • table (str) – Contains the sql requirements to query the logs

  • region (str) – Region in which the tool is executed

  • dl (bool) – True if the user wants to download the results, False if he wants the results to be written in a s3 bucket

Returns:

  • steps (list of str) – Steps to run (1 for enum, 2 for config, 3 for logs extraction, 4 for analysis)

  • source (str) – Source bucket for the analysis part (4)

  • output (str) – Output bucket for the analysis part (4)

  • database (str) – Database containing the table for logs analytics

  • table (str) – Contains the sql requirements to query the logs

  • exists (tuple of bool) – If the input db and table already exists

main.verify_timeframe(timeframe, steps)[source]

Verify the input timeframe which is used to filter queries results.

Parameters:

  • timeframe (str) – Input timeframe

  • steps (list of str) – Steps to run
